item.title: Report E-2023050344
item.description:
Report E-2023050344

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-30T15:10:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-03
  • City: MARLBORO
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 4/03/2023 Veolia employees from the Marlboro, MA 10 day intransit office were starting their day when they noticed a truck had a small frozen puddle beneath it. Upon inspection it was identified that material leaked out of an IBC and then out of the vehicle. The employees opened the box van and observed a cubic yard box (IBC) containing 118 gallon size inner containers of disinfectants was leaking. Frozen liquid was observed under the IBC and beneath the box van. The spilled disinfectant was cleaned up and absorbent was placed within the IBC and transportation to the ultimate disposal facility was continued. In total, the IBC leaked about 3 gallons of a class 8 corrosive liquid disinfectant solution. The duration of release is anticipated to be about 48 hours and an estimated 3 gallons of disinfectant leaked.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was discovered after inbound sort by Brain, he noticed that the box was wet and immediately placed it in a red hazmat bin and brought it to the hazmat cage. He placed it under the vent with the vent on. DescribePack: Upon inspection I did not find a hold at the bottom of the box, I can not pull the hazmat out of the fiberboard box seems to be glued to the box itself. The inner plastic is flimsy and the adhesive they use to keep the hazmat in place caused the leakage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed inside a red hazmat bin and taken to the hazmat cage under the vent with the vent on.

  • Description: On April 20, 2023, one (1) 1.5-gallon jug of UN3149 was crushed and released approximately one-half (.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration, LLC (ER) to remediate the impacted surfaces. ER personnel overpacked the damaged jugs into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The crews restacked the virgin containers for shipment.

item.title: Report X-2023041224
item.description:
Report X-2023041224

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-30T15:10:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-06
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED, PALED AND SENT TO THE NORTH SORT AISLE. THERE THE PACKAGE WAS SORTED INT THE BOXLINE. THE PRELOADER NOTICED LIQUID COMING OUT FROM THE BOTTOM CORNER OF THE BOX. HE STOPPED THE BOXLINE, LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACE THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS CLEANED FOLLOWING THE DMP DECONTAMINATION PROCEEDURES IN THE LEAKING PACKAGE DECISION TREE FOR DESIGNATED RESPONDERS-SMALL PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. IT WAS THEN DETERMINED TO BE AN UNDECLARED SHIPMENT.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: Driver was loading a 275 gallon tote of waste onto his truck. While pushing tote(with a powered pallet jack) onto the truck, the plastic tote receptacle contacted with force the handle of a ratchet strap securing a drum to the side of the trailer. The apparent sharpness of the handle combined with the angle and force of the contact caused a gash in the side of the tote. Subsequently approximately 100 gallons of waste spilled in the back of the trailer, proceeded out the back* onto the ground in front of the loading area. The$57,803.68 figure entered in Response Cost above includes a$51,028.68& a$6,775.00 invoice for the emergency response team and follow up reporting by the LPC. Remediation costs are included in this number. The$5000.00 figure noted in Remediation/Clean up Costs is an estimate of the collection, transportation& disposal of waste generated.

The waste drums were then transported by contractors off site for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023030081
item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-30T15:10:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-02
  • City: CHICOPEE
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT 0658 ET, XPO logistics terminal XSX called to report a 5-gallon release of battery acid impacting the dock floor at dock door 153. The pallet failed while unloading the 2400 pound battery. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 20' x 20' area of the dock floor due to the pallet failing, causing the battery on it to fall and dislodge three caps. The pallet and impacted floor were neutralized with sodium bicarb and the areas then cleaned with simple green. The battery was up-righted, wiped down, and secured on a new pallet for shipment. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon and 30-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: Facility staff observed flames develop on one of the in-transit vehicles. The local fire department was called. The fire fully engulfed the trailer and spread to 5 other in transit trailers. Because of the extensive damage to the trailer it is difficult to determine the cause of the fire. It is believed that an exothermic reaction occurred resulting in an extensive fire. At the time of the fire several hundred thousand gallons of water was used to manage and suppress the fire, all of which was contained and collected for analysis and proper disposal. Because of the layout of the facility, the fire was contained to the intransit storage area and never spread to any other property or structure.

THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM MA USING UPS ACCOUNT 7A276R, MESO SCALE DIAGNOSTICS LLC, 1601 RESEARCH BLVD, ROCKVILLE MD 20850. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: On August 1, 2022, one (1) pallet of one (1) gallon bottles of epoxy was damaged and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the asphalt surface during unloading. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Environmental Services, Inc. (ESI) to complete the necessary corrective actions. ESI personnel overpacked the damaged one (1) gallon bottles into two (2) 55-gallon drums and repalletized all non-impacted items for continued shipment. The crew then utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the impacted surface and containerized all Epoxy-impacted debris into four (4) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022090673
item.description:
Report E-2022090673

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-29T21:08:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-24
  • City: MARLBORO
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2022 at 1727 ET, Landstar contacted ERTS to request spill response for an unknown amount of UN3264 Enthone - Viaform Make-Up LA on trailer # 668790. Green Site Services Group (GSS) arrived on site at 2200 EST to assess the impacted areas. A photo of the cause of damage to the drum was not able to be done since it was already overpacked, but the terminal manager informed GSS that there was a small nail puncture on the bottom. GSS was able to indicate that 2 gallons of UN3264, Corrosive Liquids, Acidic, Inorganic, N.O.S (Sulphuric Acid/Copper Sulphate) had leaked from one 55-gallon DF. One 55-gallon poly drum was damaged and was already overpacked into a 95-gallon poly drum. Terminal personnel also generated a 55-gallon metal drum of absorbents, GSS overpacked the metal drum into a 95-gallon poly drum. 2 gallons of product spilled in total under the trailer in a 1ft by 3ft area as well as a 4ft by 4ft area. GSS unloaded and confirmed no other drums were damaged but two pallets were impacted. A soda ash solution was used to neutralize the impacted areas. Before the crew departed the site one additional 55-gallon poly drum containing impacted pallets and absorbents was generated. GGS departed the site with all waste to properly dispose of.

  • City: CHELSEA
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GULF OIL LIMITED PARTNERSHIP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 7th at 05:43, a user malfunction (human error) resulted in a release of 200 gallons of gasoline onto a concrete paved pad that proceeded to run off to two catch-basins leading to an oi/water separator. Terminal employees immediately deployed absorbent material to clean up the pooling gasoline from the loading rack pad. One 55-gallon drum of petroleum impacted absorbent material was generated from the concrete paved pad and was transported offsite for disposal (to the destination noted on this form). The remaining runoff pooling in the oil/water separator was collected using two 3,000-gallon capacity vacuum trucks. Once the gasoline was skimmed from the top layer in the oil/water separator, both trucks were filled with a total of 5,491 gallons of petroleum/water mixture and transported offsite for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2022090033
item.description:
Report I-2022090033

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-29T21:08:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-08
  • City: PALMER
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: NATIONAL FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While traveling, the NFl vehicle was involved in an accident, which damaged the engine on the tractor. As a result, approximately 10 gallons of motor oil were released to the soil grass area adjacent the roadway, which led to a drainage swale. The Massachusetts Department of Environmental Protection responded to assess the site. Environmental Services lnc.(ESl) was dispatched to the site to secure and contain the spill. Tow Company pumped off the diesel fuel from the saddle tanks, and only motor oil was evident within roadside soils into drainage swale. ESI applied boom to secure the area and contained the spill. ESI returned to the site the following day, following rainfall, to swap out existing boom and assess site. Joel Rees of MADEP met them on site to discuss plan of action. Excavation scheduled for 7/6/2022, following receipt of applicable permits. Jewell Environmental was hired for LSP services. Following site excavation, site will be restored, disposal wil be coordinated directly by ESI, and applicable reports will be submitted to MADEP by Jewell Environmental, as required. There was no impact to state waters. There were no injuries or exposures as a result of the release.

WHEN THE PACKAGE REACHED THE BOTTOM OF THE CHUTE, THE SORT PERSON SAW THE PACKAGE WAS TORN AND IT CONTAINED AN AEROSOL CAN WITH NO OUTER MARKINGS. SHE REMOVE THE PACKAGE FROM THE SMALL SORT AREA AND CALLED FOR A SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AREA TO BE INSPECTED AS AN UNDECLARED SHIPMENT. THE RESPONDER THEN PULLED UP THE SDS SHEET FOR THE PRODUCT, "WOOLITE CARPET AND UPHOLSTERY" IN AN AEROSOL CAN. SECTION 14 IN THE SDS NOTED IT WAS A "LIMITED QUANTITY" THE PACKAGE THEN PROCESSED AS AN UNDECLARED. '

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED IN THE PRIMARY UNLOAD. THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED ONTO THE UNLOAD DEVICE AND PALED. NOTICED A WET SPOT ON THE CORNER OF THE BOX. STOPPED THE BELT, LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFICED SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, CLEANED UP THE AREA. PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS CLEANED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. THERE THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO CONTAIN 6 DIFFERENT HAZMATS. UNDECLARED AEROSOLS AND CORROSIVES.
